title: Cognitive Load Management in Programming Learning: Effective Strategies Using Visualization Tools

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic programming syntax (variables, conditionals, loops) and experience designing simple algorithms
context.additional_context: Learners use personal devices to engage in online visualization tools and offline hands-on activities simultaneously, with achievement levels measured through project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and explain the code execution process step-by-step using program visualization tools (e.g., JELIOT, BlueJ)
Learners can apply strategies to reduce cognitive load by over 30% by converting complex code structures into visual maps
Learners can improve code comprehension and reduce problem-solving time by 20% through collaborative pair programming
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
